subject: Ethics
title: Can Corporations Be Moral Agents
description: Learn Can Corporations Be Moral Agents in one minute.

hook.text: When BP spilled oil in the Gulf, we blamed 'BP.' But BP is a legal fiction. Paper can't feel guilt.

buildup.text: Corporations have legal personhoodâ€”they can sue, own property, and sign contracts. But can they be moral?

discovery.text: Peter French argued yes: corporate structures create intentions beyond any individual employee's choices.

twist.text: Critics counter: only humans feel remorse. Corporate 'apologies' are written by PR teams calculating damage control.

climax.text: If corporations aren't moral agents, can we ethically punish them? Or should we only punish the humans inside?

punchline.text: We gave corporations rights. The duties are still debatable.

quiz.question: What did philosopher Peter French argue about corporations?
options: Corporations can never have any moral responsibility
Corporate structures create collective intentions that make them moral agents
Only shareholders bear moral responsibility for corporate actions
